title: If the problem is not solved, the contradiction will always exist? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not necessarily, given that the cause for a problem was a misinterpretation or misunderstanding that can be ultimately clarified, i.e. no solution needed. I also do believe without a clear definition of a solution for a given problem, contradictions will always exist no matter what solution is.
Problems can never be solved that is why contradiction exists. If problem is solution and understood clearly then all contradiction ends.
